intro: Eragrostis dielsii f. pimilio, commonly known as the silvergrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage, which results from dense pubescence covering the leaves. This plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to drought conditions. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear minute flowers, typical of many grass species. The f. pimilio form is distinguished by its more pronounced silvery appearance compared to the typical form of Eragrostis dielsii.
